intro: Hijmania, commonly known as the Mexican heather, is a genus of flowering plants in the Ericaceae family. It is native to Mexico and parts of Central America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plants typically have small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Hijmania species are often found in rocky or well-drained soils, and they are adapted to dry environments. Their foliage is usually evergreen, with leathery leaves that help reduce water loss.
